metadata.Title: CVE-2012-5825 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Tweepy does not verify that the server hostname matches a domain name in the subject's Common Name (CN) or subjectAltName field of the X.509 certificate, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to spoof SSL servers via an arbitrary valid certificate, related to use of the Python httplib library.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-5825` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-tweepy - 3.1.0-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tweepy package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.1.0-2').
